cs.man.ac.uk.log

Class LogManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs.man.ac.uk.log.LogManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    I_LogManager

    public class LogManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements I_LogManager
    This class is used to provide a wrapper for logging utilities. It is used to toggle verbose logging statements on and off in this application, through the use of a command line argument passed to this class's constructor. A single copy of this class is initialised in the applications main method, and this instance is then used throughout the program. This is used instead of Java's own logging classes for the sake of simplicity.
    Version:
    1.0, 05/02/13
    Author:
    Rob Lyon

    • Constructor Detail

      • LogManager

        public LogManager(java.lang.String pth,
                  boolean enableLogging)
        Primary constructor that builds a new logger instance. If the boolean flag passed to this constructor is true, verbose logging will be enabled. If the flag is false, verbose logging will be disabled, however error logging will continue.
        Parameters:
        pth - the path to the log file.
        enableLogging - the verbose logging flag.
